intro: Phyla strigulosa var. sericea, commonly known as the silverleaf phyla, is a variant of the Phyla strigulosa species, characterized by its silvery, hairy foliage. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide range of flowering plants. The plant is native to certain regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine, white hairs that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, contributing to its ecological role in its native habitat.
